text: Hypatima xerophanta is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1930. It is found in Vietnam. The wingspan is about 18 mm. The forewings are whitish ochreous or pale ochreous partially tinged with yellowish, with the costal half sometimes with indistinct pale brownish streaks. There is a narrow streak of fuscous suffusion along the costa from before the middle to three-fourths, as well as a brownish or fuscous oval spot in the disc before the middle, accompanied by some raised scales, and a smaller more indistinct or yellowish similar spot on the end of the cell, with a few black or dark fuscous scales towards the costa beyond this. The hindwings are grey, lighter towards the base.Annales de la Société Entomologique de France. 99 (Suppl): 724. ==References== Category:Hypatima Category:Moths described in 1930
title: Hypatima xerophanta
